Data: 1.49pm Tim Paine won the toss to lift Australian spirits... has the mood change made it all the way to Samara? I think it might have, you know...
Wood to Finch, FOUR runs short, and dismissively hoicked through backward square leg! Decent pace, but that was nailed!
Wood to Finch, no run wider line, 86mph, might have been given as wide but for a toe-ended thump to point
Wood to Finch, no run climbing through to the keeper, swinging away
Wood to Finch, 1 run jabbed through third man, nip away from the bat but well enough connected
Wood to Head, no run solidly into line and defended back down the pitch
Wood to Head, no run tapped into the leg side, that's a good recovery from that first-ball four
Willey to Finch, no run back of a length, and sure enough, this one tails back a touch and cracks Finch high on the pads
Willey to Finch, 1 leg bye curling into the pads, a bit of an ambitious single but Buttler's shy from behind the stumps is about as hopeless as you'll ever see in international cricket
Willey to Head, no run curling away from the left-hander, two slips in place as Head leans forward to defend
Willey to Head, 1 run width, more swing, driven off a fat under-edge, out through square leg
Willey to Finch, 3 runs lovely strike, meeting the full length with a compact drive, perfectly bissecting the two cover fielders
Willey to Head, no run tight line outside off, poked out to the off side
Wood to Finch, no run back of a length, lifting sharply as FInch misses out on a cramped pull
Wood to Finch, no run wicket to wicket line, blocked solidly back down the pitch
Wood to Finch, no run tight to the off stump, pushed into the covers
Wood to Finch, no run defended back down the wicket

Wood to Finch, no run dropped but what an effort! Hales at short midwicket, stuck out his right hand with the ball almost behind him, Ben Stokes at Trent Bridge fashion, but he couldn't claw it in as he fell to the ground!
Wood to Finch, no run defended back down the pitch
Willey to Head, FOUR runs too wide, and slapped firmly through the covers
Willey to Head, no run swinging late, half driven down to the man at mid-off
Willey to Head, no run swing once more, wide of off stump, but Head can't line it up with a back-foot slap
Willey to Head, no run through to the keeper on a wide line once more
Willey to Head, no run half an appeal, and England think seriously about the review, Head was deep in the crease, but that was down the leg side
Willey to Head, no run solidly forward to block on a middle and leg line
Wood to Finch, 1 wide banged in short, over the shoulder
Wood to Finch, 1 run on the pads, worked to backward square leg
Wood to Head, 2 runs nudged off the hip, into space on the leg side
Wood to Head, 1 run deflected round the corner once more
Wood to Finch, no run tight line on a full length, Finch defends firmly off the back foot
Wood to Finch, no run very full, and Wood is almost up for the lbw appeal, but reckons rightly that that was heading down leg
Wood to Finch, no run full and straight, no way through there, pushed to cover
Willey to Head, no run slashed to the leg side, no great foot movement as Head plays the swing off the pitch
Willey to Head, FOUR runs fenced into the gap clean down the ground, that's superb timing! Met the ball on the top of the bounce and eased it through long-on
Willey to Head, 1 run chiselled in the air, out to deep midwicket
Willey to Finch, FOUR runs crunching drive! This is better intent from Australia, striding out to meet the ball and flogging it clean through the covers
Willey to Finch, no run back of a length, glided out to point where it is gathered on the run to prevent the single
Willey to Finch, no run tucked to the leg side
Wood to Head, no run back of a length, Wood falls over in his followthrough, but he's delivered the ball nicely into the channel. Poked to point
Wood to Head, FOUR runs sweetly on-driven! Just a touch over-pitched from Wood, right under the eyeline and launched back through the bowler's grasp
Wood to Head, no run flicked to leg, looking for the single, but Buttler swoops
Wood to Head, no run banged in short, Head ducks
Wood to Head, 2 runs much wider on the crease, Head reads the revised angle and flicks urgently out through square leg
Wood to Head, FOUR runs whipped through backward square leg. The runs are starting to flow now
Willey to Finch, no run defended off the back foot, gathered in the followthrough
Willey to Finch, no run tapped to the leg side, gathered at short midwicket
Willey to Finch, no run fuller length, hovering around the off stump, and blocked back down the pitch
Willey to Finch, 1 run back of a length once again, on a middle and leg line, Finch tries to work it square but can't connect properly
Willey to Head, FOUR runs another lovely drive, clean through extra cover with a big stride and a full face
Willey to Head, no run pushed onto the back foot, blocked out to point
Root to Finch, no run round the wicket, on the pads, tucked to short square
Root to Finch, 1 leg bye full length, strikes the pad as well as bat, but the line from round the wicket makes the sweep a safe option
Root to Head, no run faster through the air, punched uppishly to short midwicket
Root to Head, no run whittled into the leg side, short midwicket is in action again
Root to Head, FOUR runs that's well played, lots more air from Root, and Head skips down the pitch to drill through wide long-off
Root to Head, 1 run flipped through the leg side to complete the over
Overton to Head, FOUR runs outside off, slammed through point. A bit of a nervy sighter
Overton to Head, no run wide line once again but a sharper pace, climbs over another attempted cut/carve
Overton to Head, no run on the back foot, punched back down the pitch without much conviction
Overton to Head, FOUR runs chopped down into the crease, and so nearly onto the stumps! Misses the timbers by a whisker, and Buttler is wrong-footed too
Overton to Head, no run firmly onto the front foot to block this time
Overton to Head, FOUR runs beautiful drive. Too wide from Overton, in the slot for a tonk, and battered through the covers
Root to Finch, 1 run round the wicket, nudged to the leg side
Root to Head, no run tweaking into the left-hander, met with a full face on the back foot
Root to Head, no run whoops! An attempt at violence from Head, but he loses his shape as he skips down the pitch and is lucky to get enough bat on the ball to spare him the stumping
Root to Head, 1 run worked to leg
Root to Finch, 1 run tapped into the covers
Root to Head, 1 run advancing down the track, and worked to the leg side
Overton to Head, no run well bowled! That's better from Overton, a yard fuller, and tighter to the off stump. Angled across and lifting past the left-hander's edge
Overton to Head, 1 run shorter and wider, slapped to cover for the single
Overton to Finch, 2 runs flipped into the leg side
Overton to Finch, no run tight line on off stump, and pushed back down the pitch
Overton to Finch, 1 run tip and run, and through they gallop, a single to mid-on
Overton to Head, 1 run blocked back down the pitch
Root to Head, 1 run thumped down to long-off
Root to Finch, 1 run nurdled into the off side
Root to Head, 1 run cracked into the covers, and up comes Head's fifty. A well-compiled knock, from 43 balls. He's dominated this opening stand
Root to Finch, 1 run tapped to the leg side
Root to Head, no run advancing down the wicket, crashed to cover
Root to Head, 1 run on the back foot, fenced into the covers
Overton to Head, no run thumped on the up to short cover, tighter lines from Overton
Overton to Head, 2 runs clipped out to deep midwicket, a long chase for the sweeper
Overton to Head, 2 runs a swishing pull, out to deep square leg. Good connection and two more to the total
Overton to Head, no run punched firmly to mid-off
Overton to Head, no run a cramped cut to backward point
Overton to Head, no run punched to the off side
Root to Finch, 1 run round the wicket once more, cramping the right-hander for room on the pads, and tucked square
Root to Head, 1 run advancing the bowler, but can't rifle the drive through the gap
Root to Finch, no run flipped to short midwicket
Root to Finch, 1 run looped up, onto the legs, clipped to the leg side once more
Root to Head, no run solid block on the front foot
Root to Head, no run faster and flatter, nearly wheedles its way through
Overton to Finch, no run outside off, good lift from back of a length, jabbed down into the pitch
Overton to Finch, no run wider line, patted to short cover
Overton to Finch, 1 run advancing down the pitch, worked to the leg side for another single
Overton to Head, no run drilled to wide mid-off, but with no great timing
Overton to Head, 1 run clipped out to the leg side
Overton to Finch, 1 run fuller length, attacking the top of off, deflected behind point
Root to Finch, no run round the wicket again, punched to mid-off
Root to Finch, no run down on the sweep, could have been a wide if he'd left it, but instead merely tapped to the man on the 45
Root to Finch, 1 run worked to the leg side again
Root to Head, no run crashing drive, advancing down the pitch, but well intercepted in the covers
Root to Head, 1 run nudged to the leg side, can't get him away
Root to Finch, 1 run Finch was advancing, but Root saw him coming, held it back in the flight. That's a tremendous over
Rashid to Finch, 1 run googly to start, punched off the back foot, through long-on
Rashid to Head, 1 run looping onto a good length outside off, tapped off the back foot to mid-off
Rashid to Finch, 1 run wider line, cracked with decent timing to wide long-off
Rashid to Head, 1 run spanked out to wide long-off
Rashid to Finch, no run turned off the pads, and this could be trouble! Thoughts of a chaotic single, but wisely turned down as square leg swooped
Rashid to Finch, no run firmly blotted back down the track
Root to Head, 1 run wide outside off, urgently cut through point
Root to Finch, 1 run on the pads, nurdled to the midwicket sweeper
Root to Head, 1 run advancing down the track but just another single, clipped to the leg side
Root to Finch, FOUR runs tossed up, way down the leg side, Finch smashes it behind the keeper. A rare poor ball, perhaps anticipated a stumping chance, but it was too telegraphed
Root to Finch, 1 run flicked to leg once more to bring up the 100
Root to Head, 1 run keeps low as it slides in from outside off, chopped through point

Rashid to Head, OUT a dirty half-tracker, and tanked straight to the man at deep midwicket! Head is aghast, what a gruesome way to give it away. The long-hop lures him out of his cautious mindset, he seeks to clear the rope, and England have their opening!
Rashid to Marsh, no run stays over the wicket, tossed up and tapped back down the track
Rashid to Marsh, no run flighted, chipped to the left of the bowler, bump ball
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs googly, spinning away and sliced, but gully can't get a hand on it! Superb diving effort but it loops out of reach, don't think he quite got to the ball
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run worked into the leg side off the pads
Rashid to Finch, 1 run tossed up and nudged for one
Root to Finch, 1 run lobbed up leg side and worked off the pads
Root to Marsh, no run stays round the wicket, Marsh taps the ball back
Root to Marsh, no run tossed up, no width and Marsh defends
Root to Marsh, 1 run comes across, dabs the ball down square on the off side for a single in front of point
Root to Finch, no run pushed through flat on the pads, Finch tickles it fine but the man on the edge of the ring prevents one
Root to Finch, no run full and straight, tapped gently away
Rashid to Marsh, no run pushed through and chopped back down the track
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run punched into the ground to the left of Rashid, who gets a hand on it but can't prevent one
Rashid to Finch, 1 run floated up and driven through the covers for one
Rashid to Marsh, no run pushed through, can't get this one away
Rashid to Marsh, FOUR runs full, outside leg stump, possibly the googly but Marsh is to the pitch and sweeps forcefully past short fine leg, Moeen sprawls but can't prevent four
Rashid to Marsh, no run worked off the legs to midwicket
Root to Finch, 1 run flat on the pads and Finch is happy to nurdle away
Root to Marsh, 1 run tossed up and stroked through the covers on the front foot
Root to Finch, 1 run flat and on leg stump, tickled into a gap at midwicket
Root to Marsh, 1 run flighted a bit more, Marsh drives and it comes off the inside half of the bat
Root to Finch, 1 run dobbed on the stumps, worked away
Root to Marsh, 1 wide pushes this one down the leg side
Root to Marsh, 1 run floated up full and Marsh prods one more into the covers
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run comes down and works a single down the ground
Rashid to Finch, no run flighted, Finch blocks to leg
Rashid to Finch, SIX runs hi ho Silver! That's gone all the way over long-on, picked the googly and slugged it powerfully beyond the ropes
Rashid to Finch, 1 run flatter, outside off and steered away off the back foot
Rashid to Marsh, no run pushed through and whipped to short midwicket
Rashid to Marsh, no run nicely bowled, slips in the googly and Marsh is beaten as the ball thuds into the gloves
Root to Finch, no run flat on the stumps, can't do much with it
Root to Finch, 1 run floated up on leg stump, flicked for one more
Root to Marsh, no run Marsh taps into the covers
Root to Marsh, no run angled in with the arm and Marsh shows this a straight bat
Root to Marsh, 1 run floated up full and Marsh dinks one into a gap out towards deep cover
Root to Finch, 1 run on the stumps and nudged off the pads again - that's fifty for Finch, a sedate innings so far but we know he can go big
Rashid to Finch, 1 run floated up and driven into a gap coming forwards
Rashid to Marsh, no run goes for the sweep but picks out the fielder on the edge of the ring
Rashid to Marsh, no run flighted, pushed back down the track to the bowler
Rashid to Marsh, no run slips in the Bosie again, this time Marsh misses flicking across the line and is hit on the pad, pitched outside leg
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run comes forward and drives this through mid-on for a single
Rashid to Finch, no run gives this some air, Finch reaches forward and blocks
Root to Marsh, 2 runs short of a length and worked off the hip behind deep backward square for a couple
Root to Marsh, no run tossed up and defended on off
Root to Marsh, no run flat, pushed into the covers... another dot ball
Root to Marsh, no run angled in and Marsh flicks against the spin to midwicket
Root to Marsh, 1 run flighted, this time Marsh manages to pick a gap coming forwards
Root to Finch, no run dobbed on the stumps one last time and Finch blocks - that is Root bowled out, 10 overs for 44, only the second time he has completed his allocation in ODIs
Rashid to Marsh, no run Rashid tosses the ball up and Marsh prods it back
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run full on the stumps, paddled away to leg for a single
Rashid to Finch, no run lobs up the googly, hits the inside edge as Finch presses forwards
Rashid to Finch, 1 run flighted, comes across on off and drives for one
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run floated up full on leg stump, March whips one down the ground
Rashid to Finch, SIX runs full and juicy, gets it a bit too straight, Finch whumps it back over long-on again! Second six, a meaty blow down the ground, turns that into a decent over for Australia
Ali to Marsh, 2 runs tossed up and driven firmly, placed in front of deep cover but Billings does well to haul it in
Ali to Marsh, 2 runs round the wicket, full and punched in front of the sweeper again
Ali to Marsh, no run flatter and tapped towards point
Ali to Marsh, 1 run worked down the ground
Ali to Finch, 1 run tossed up, Finch turns the ball into the leg side with the spin - fifty stand between these two
Ali to Marsh, no run pushed through on off, Marsh taps it to the fielder
Rashid to Finch, 1 run legbreak, spinning away outside off, Finch drops back and cuts
Rashid to Marsh, no run flighted, drifting across as Marsh comes down, defended
Rashid to Marsh, no run floated up and clipped to mid-on
Rashid to Marsh, no run can't get this one away
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run stays back and plays with the spin through square leg for one
Rashid to Finch, no run gives this some air, Finch defends watchfully
Ali to Marsh, 1 run pushed through from round the wicket, Marsh dabs into a gap
Ali to Finch, no run fired in straight, Finch blocks it back down the track
Ali to Finch, 2 runs flatter, worked through square leg and they come hustling back for two
Ali to Finch, no run on the stumps, Finch taps it down
Ali to Finch, no run flighted, outside off and met with a forward block
Ali to Finch, 1 run touch short and Finch can stay in the crease and clip a single behind square

Overton to Finch, 2 runs short of a length, Finch helps it down towards deep backward square leg, Marsh has to hurry and put in a dive at the bowler's end... but he's fine, after a check with the TV umpire
Overton to Finch, 1 run length ball, 80mph and Finch blocks, gets an inside edge between his legs and they scamper through
Overton to Marsh, 1 run pitched up and clipped off the pads
Overton to Finch, 2 runs shortish, 81mph and Finch runs it away off his pads, fine leg has to run across and they get comfortably back this time
Overton to Finch, 1 run length in the channel, met on the front foot and blunted through the covers for one
Overton to Marsh, 1 run angled across, Marsh drops back and dabs into the ground behind backward point
Ali to Marsh, no run gives it a bit of air, drifting leg side and Marsh swings across the line... maybe just flicked the pad on its way through
Ali to Marsh, 1 run flat outside off, Marsh drops back to cut for a single
Ali to Finch, 1 run tossed up and tickled back down the ground to long-on
Ali to Marsh, 1 run flat, Marsh stays in the crease and punches though mid-on
Ali to Finch, no run pushed through outside off, not much turn and Finch dabs it to short third man
Ali to Finch, no run angled in flat and Finch defends back to the bowler
Overton to Marsh, 2 runs length on the pads, Marsh clips through midwicket and comes back for a second... a direct hit from the deep and he would have been struggling!
Overton to Marsh, 1 run short ball, Marsh pulls and gets a swirling top edge... but it lands well in front of fine leg and they trot through
Overton to Finch, FOUR runs here we go, Finch takes a bite out of Overton - clumps a lofted drive high over mid-off, there's no man back and it bounces away to the rope
Overton to Finch, no run back of a length, defended into the off side
Overton to Finch, 2 runs shortish and worked off the legs, two more there
Overton to Finch, 1 run pitched up, around off stump and Finch toe-ends a drive to mid-off, they hurry through for the single
Ali to Finch, no run fired down on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
Ali to Finch, 1 run little bit of turn this time and Finch works the ball through square for a single
Ali to Marsh, FOUR runs Marsh gets this away, the sweep has been his preferred outlet for aggression against spin and he sends this skimming through backward square leg for four
Ali to Marsh, 1 run tossed up and clipped down the ground
Ali to Finch, 1 run flat outside off, Finch drops back and dabs another single
Ali to Marsh, 1 run on the stumps, clipped down the ground for one more
Overton to Marsh, no run short of a length, Marsh hit on the pads playing back
Overton to Marsh, 1 run dug in, Marsh swivels on the pull for one through midwicket
Overton to Finch, FOUR runs crrrrrrrrrrrrrrunched! That's a bit more like it, Finch bullies this off a length, a forearm jab through mdiwicket for four
Overton to Finch, 1 run on the stumps, worked for one
Overton to Marsh, 1 run short of a length, Marsh continues to tick over with a leg glance
Overton to Finch, SIX runs dug in, but that's a powder-puff half-tracker and Finch wallops it handsomely over deep square leg for six! Finch into the 90s, they're kicking up a gear
Ali to Marsh, 1 run angled in and tucked for a single
Ali to Finch, no run flat on the stumps, defended to the on side
Ali to Finch, no run no width and Finch tucks it back to the bowler
Ali to Finch, 1 run on the stumps, Finch gets right back and works this French cricket style square of midwicket to bring up the Australia 200
Ali to Marsh, 1 run dragged short, Marsh is off balance cutting and only gets one to deep point
Ali to Finch, 1 run pushed through, Finch chops another single through backward point
Wood to Finch, 1 run length, 84mph and sliding into the pads, Finch clips to mid-on who is back a little and they take one
Wood to Marsh, 2 runs touch full, worked into the leg side, there's a couple more as the man hares in off the rope
Wood to Marsh, no run short of a length, 84mph and forced to mid-on off the back foot
Wood to Marsh, 1 run angled across, Marsh reaches for the cut and gets one through the covers
Wood to Finch, FOUR runs pitched up, goes for the yorker but it drifts leg side and Finch gets a tickle on the ball, sending it wide of Buttler for four
Wood to Finch, no run better line, Finch blocks on off
Ali to Marsh, SIX runs tossed up, Marsh goes down town... launched into the bleachers at long-on! Takes him to his half-century, a clean, crisp swing and fetched well back beyond the rope
Ali to Marsh, 1 run comes down and drills this for one
Ali to Finch, 2 runs pushed through, Finch goes back and dabs late for a couple
Ali to Finch, 1 run tossed up, Finch sits on it for a single into the covers... that's his hundred, sixth against England in ODIs. Off comes the helmet, taking in the applause. Time to unleash?
Ali to Marsh, no run pushed through and defended
Ali to Marsh, FOUR runs swatted away over midwicket! Moeen drops short and Marsh rocks back to heave it over the infield for four more

Wood to Finch, OUT oh, pinned him in front! Finch is plumb lbw playing across the line, Wood has the breakthrough out of nothing! It was all very placid out there, and now Finch has missed a straight one
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run outside off, a thick outside edge, through to third man
Wood to Marsh, no run solidly onto the front foot, and walloped to mid-off. There's been a lot of that today, technically correct drives straight to the fielder. Oodles of respect for the bowling
Wood to Marsh, 1 run flipped to the leg side

Wood to Stoinis, OUT bowled him! That is a beauty from Wood, shaping in, just a hint of reverse maybe, skidding through Stoinis's half-cocked defences. Had he got forward he might have had more chance ... of lbw
Wood to Agar, 1 run stabbed through third man to get off the mark
Ali to Agar, 1 run round the wicket, back of a length, chopped out to deep cover
Ali to Marsh, no run a high-elbowed drive, straight to cover
Ali to Marsh, 1 run width outside off, stabbed to point. Marsh is hobbling somewhat now, but no runners allowed
Ali to Agar, no run lines up the big drive, but merely nudged to cover
Ali to Agar, 1 run tucked off the pads to the leg side
Ali to Marsh, 1 run roll of the wrists, eased down to long-on
Wood to Marsh, no run round the wicket, punched from an upright stance to short midwicket
Wood to Marsh, no run outside off, dabbed to point for another single
Wood to Marsh, 1 run dabbed out to point
Wood to Agar, no run pushed to cover, looking for the single but sent back
Wood to Agar, 1 run guided into the covers once more
Wood to Marsh, 1 run hauled round the corner to the sweeper at deep midwicket
Rashid to Marsh, 1 wide googly, starts wide, spins wider
Rashid to Marsh, SIX runs absolutely battered! He picked that googly with no problems, a massive wipe across the line and deep into the stands at cow corner
Rashid to Marsh, FOUR runs shorter, wider, pushed out of the front of the hand, and just helped behind square
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs fuller length, smeared along the deck to deep midwicket
Rashid to Marsh, FOUR runs hooned through the covers, this is a terrific turn of pace from the hobbling Marsh. Cracking it on the up to ruin Rashid's figures
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs thumped out to the deep

Rashid to Marsh, SIX runs smashed high over the leg side, and up comes Shaun Marsh's second hundred of the series! Absolutely brilliant acceleration in the later stages of his innings, and it's a 91-ball hundred, which is useful in any context
Willey to Carey, OUT low full toss, swinging into the toes, and Carey holes out to deep midwicket! He nailed it, to be fair, but straight to the man.

Willey to Marsh, OUT stunning from Roy on the long-on boundary! Another massive wind-up, it dips late on the boundary's edge, where Roy clings on, running towards the rope. He has the presence of mind to pick out Craig Overton ten metres away, running round from midwicket,
Willey to Paine, 1 run cracked to mid-off to survive the hat-trick ball
Willey to Neser, 2 runs thumped out to deep midwicket
Willey to Neser, OUT edged, gone, and it's three in the over! Who says Willey isn't a death bowler? Neser makes room outside leg, feathers his off-side slap and Australia are subsiding rapidly
Willey to Jhye Richardson, no run yorker, well dug out. That was a lively over
Wood to Paine, 1 run attempted yorker, tailing into the pads, chiselled round the corner to bring up the 300
Wood to Jhye Richardson, no run an under-edged smear, Buttler does well to drop a glove on it
Wood to Jhye Richardson, 1 run attacking the stumps on a full length, clipped hard to long-on
Wood to Paine, no run well bowled again, a pinpoint yorker, nothing for Paine to do but dig it out
Wood to Paine, 1 wide wider line, speared down the leg side this time
Wood to Paine, 1 run crunched out to deep cover
Wood to Jhye Richardson, 1 run rolls the fingers on another attempted yorker, chopped out to backward point
Willey to Jhye Richardson, 1 run smeared along the ground to long-on, lining up the outswing and connecting well enough

Willey to Paine, OUT round the wicket, angled into the pads, and Willey strikes again! Another slog across the line, but was he struck outside the line? Paine can't be bothered to review... but that was umpire's call ... very marginal!
Willey to Lyon, 2 runs slammed high in the air, who wants this? Willey wants this! He sprints out to midwicket, but can't quite reach it to complete his five-for
Willey to Lyon, no run length ball, fizzes through a wild swing
Willey to Lyon, 1 run cracked airily out to cover, where Morgan pounces with one hand, which briefly discombobulates Richardson. But he gets back safely
Willey to Jhye Richardson, 2 runs thumped to cover, and that's the end of Australia's spirited innings
A very England-at-the-2015-World-Cup total. How did that pan out? Oh ...

5.10pm So, Australia amass 310 for 8, which might have been a big total ten years ago, but right at this moment of time, it feels a touch underwhelming. But credit where it is due to Australia. Two centuries have given them a fighting chance, and an ODI ground record too. Back in

Hello again. We'll be cracking on with the run chase at CLS soon enough... This is the approach I expect England to take. Once upon a time, 300 was pretty much the final frontier for chasing - England managed it twice between 1971 and 2014 - but times have changed. Won't be long
Here come Jason Roy and Jonny Bairstow, not exactly fresh off the back of 481 - having spent a few sweaty hours in the field - but raring to go, I'm sure. Michael Neser will open the bowling
Neser to Roy, FOUR runs short and on the hip, Roy clips it firmly away, past the dive of short fine leg for four off the first ball! Well, I suppose Finch did the same
Neser to Roy, no run pitched up on off, diligent lines and Roy defends this time
Neser to Roy, no run touch shorter, forced down into the ground and towards mid-off
Neser to Roy, no run comes across, Roy gets a little tangled up trying to whip the ball to leg
Neser to Roy, 1 run length in the channel, thick-edged down to third man
Neser to Bairstow, no run tight lines, YJB defends towards mid-on... decent start from Neser
Stanlake to Roy, 1 run back of a length, turned off the body and wide of mid-on for one
Stanlake to Bairstow, 1 run similar length, rising over off stump and Bairstow gets off the mark with a similar turn to leg
Stanlake to Roy, 2 runs short and rising, Roy rolls the wrists and sends the ball in front of deep square leg, they come racing back for two

Stanlake to Roy, FOUR runs larruped through extra cover! What a shot that is, not overly full but the bounce is true and Roy steps out to ping it through the infield, rebounding off the middle of the bat with interest
Stanlake to Roy, no run good length on off, defended this time
Stanlake to Roy, FOUR runs touch too full, that's stroked for four more! Leans into the shot, all timing back down the ground... England into their stride
Neser to Bairstow, no run good length and punched back to the bowler
Neser to Bairstow, FOUR runs pitched up and smashed through the covers again, YJB eases the boundary count on by one
Neser to Bairstow, no run comes across and pushes a length ball into the off side
Neser to Bairstow, no run slams into the back leg, Neser goes up... but Michael Gough shakes his head! Maybe nipping down the leg side? Ah, perhaps some inside edge on it, too
Neser to Bairstow, no run turned into the midwicket area
Neser to Bairstow, no run full outside off, YJB throws the hands but doesn't connect cleanly and the ball dribbles to cover
Stanlake to Roy, SIX runs banged in, too quick for Roy on the pull... but nevermind, his top-edge flies all the way over fine leg for six! Safe option, with no one outside the ring down there
Stanlake to Roy, no run dug in back of a length, Roy rides the bounce
Stanlake to Roy, no run straighter line, Roy blocks it back down the track
Stanlake to Roy, no run touch short, angling in with the arm, tucked defensively into the leg side
Stanlake to Roy, FOUR runs too full, that's in the slot again and Roy skewers it through the covers for another boundary. Ho hum
Stanlake to Roy, FOUR runs back of a length, rising up towards the hip, Ropy only needs to tuck it away on the pull and it races to fine leg for four more!
Neser to Bairstow, 1 run pitched up and driven through cover, there's a sweeper out there now
Neser to Roy, no run fullish, on the stumps and worked towards mid-on
Neser to Roy, no run full in the channel, this keeps a touch low as Roy swings for the hills and fails to connect
Neser to Roy, no run short but taking the pace off, Roy is through his pull shot early and gets a bottom edge wide of the Paine, who gets across
Neser to Roy, 2 runs too straight, this is flicked off the legs wide of short fine and Stanlake has to lumber into gear to prevent a boundary
Neser to Roy, no run fourth-stump line, driven on the up to extra cover
Lyon to Bairstow, FOUR runs pushed through, bit of turn but the ball sits up nicely on off stump and Bairstow carves it through point for four
Lyon to Bairstow, no run tossed up, tapped down into the covers
Lyon to Bairstow, 3 runs slightly short and steered through backward point, lovely placement but it's just about reeled in in front of the rope
Lyon to Roy, no run pushed through quicker, bit of overspin as Roy waits in the crease and tucks to midwicket
Lyon to Roy, no run floated up, punched to cover coming across
Lyon to Roy, 1 run flighted, spinning in and worked towards mid-on, it's a tight single but Roy calls it and looks to be home... although the throw is wayward
Neser to Roy, 1 run back of a length, rasped into the off side and they pinch one with the fielder back
Neser to Bairstow, FOUR runs on the pads, that's a poor ball with no protection and Bairstow just calmly fiddles it away to the fine leg boundary - that's the England 50 up, lickety-split
Neser to Bairstow, 1 run fullish, middle and leg stump, clipped through midwicket
Neser to Roy, FOUR runs on the legs again, Roy doesn't have to exert himself in glancing four more through backward square
Neser to Roy, FOUR runs shot! That is dismissive from Roy, coming forward to a back-of-a-length delivery and he just throws the hands through a punch past point
Neser to Roy, 1 run on the stumps and tucked for one
Lyon to Roy, no run looped up on off and Roy works to midwicket
Lyon to Roy, 2 runs uses the feet, comes down and whips in front of deep midwicket for a couple
Lyon to Roy, no run goes back and cuts into the off side
Lyon to Roy, no run tossed up and dinked to mid-on coming forwards
Lyon to Roy, no run tight lines, Roy taps into the covers again
Lyon to Roy, FOUR runs and theeeeeerrrre's the release boundary... touch short and there's the width for Roy to crunch another cut to the fence
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs hammered through cover point, four more! Bairstow is standing on leg stump, doesn't need much width and he cashes in from Richardson's loosener
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run angled in straighter, tapped into the on side
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run good bumper, YJB ducks
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run short of a length over off stump, swatted to cover
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run Bairstow trying to make room again, driven firmly into the ground
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs dug in, tennis-ball bounce and Bairstow panhandles it up and over short third man... off the toe of the bat, I think, but it nearly sails all the way!

Agar to Roy, no run pushed through, beats the outside edge and Paine whips off the bails... they are going to check upstairs, Roy did shift his back foot fractionally but I don't think it was in the air at the time. No, Dharmasena's happy he was in
Agar to Roy, 1 run tossed up and pushed back down the ground - half-century for Roy, continuing his purple form
Agar to Bairstow, no run flat on off stump, YJB chops into the off side
Agar to Bairstow, no run ooh, nearly bowls him! Bairstow backs away and swings hard, the ball scoots through and misses everything... Past leg stump
Agar to Bairstow, no run tapped back down the track
Agar to Bairstow, no run tossed up and punched into the covers
Jhye Richardson to Roy, 1 run length ball, Roy presses forward and gets an inside edge for one
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 1 run slashed to third man, off the outside edge but it lands safely
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run stays a touch low as Roy comes across and turns to leg
Jhye Richardson to Roy, FOUR runs length ball, Roy opens the face, that's a cheeky outside edge steered wide of the keeper... four more
Jhye Richardson to Roy, 1 run angled in straighter, back of a length and taking the pace off, tickled through the leg side for one
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs gets it through, past the dive of mid-off! Touch too full and YJB gets forward, spanks a drive... not completely out of the middle but it will run away
Agar to Roy, no run pushed through on off, Roy dabs it to cover
Agar to Roy, no run comes down and misses with a work across the line
Agar to Roy, no run flat on off stump, rocks back and slaps the ball to backward point
Agar to Roy, 1 run comes forward, nicely flighted and Roy elects just to dink it through the covers for one
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run slightly too straight, Bairstow works it off his pads
Agar to Roy, 1 run floated up full, Roy tickles one down the ground to long-off
Jhye Richardson to Roy, 1 run length in the channel, Roy drives on the up through cover
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs lovely stuff, sizzled straight back down the ground! Touch full, Bairstow just hits smoothly through the line - no violence, just timing
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run slightly back of a length,YJB tries to thrash this through the covers and miscues into the turf
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run pitched up, again he swings wildly and it stays a little low, through to Paine
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 1 run punched off the back foot into the covers, a misfield helps them through
Jhye Richardson to Roy, 1 run Roy is on off stump and punches towards mid-off, again they steal the single
Agar to Roy, 1 run tossed up and driven through the covers

Agar to Bairstow, 2 runs good length, YJB gets on top of his drive and stabs it well in front of the sweeper, allowing them to come back for two... that's the century opening stand between these two, brought up in similar time to Trent Bridge on Tuesday, I'd wager
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run punched through the off side
Agar to Roy, no run flatter ball, steered to gully off the back foot
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run slashed off the back foot, runs behind square
Stanlake to Bairstow, FOUR runs touch short, that sits up nicely and Bairstow bullies a pull away to backward square leg
Stanlake to Bairstow, no run similar length, this seams in and tucks him up, YJB pulls and misses this time
Stanlake to Bairstow, 1 run chopped through cover point
Stanlake to Roy, FOUR runs muscled away to wide long-on! Didn't quite time that but Roy gets four more, hoicking the ball flat past midwicket
Stanlake to Roy, no run comes across and pokes the ball square
Stanlake to Roy, no run pitched up and Roy tries to launch this into Northumberland, comes off the bottom of the bat but lands a yard or two short of mid-on
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run tossed up and driven down the ground
Agar to Roy, 1 run flat delivery in the channel, Roy can free his arms and slap one to the sweeper
Agar to Bairstow, 2 runs chopped in the air off the back foot, not totally in control and Finch flings himself to his left... but won't get there, couple more in front of the man in the deep
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run tossed up and driven through cover point for one, that is Bairstow's fifty, too, easy does it
Agar to Roy, FOUR runs lummy, here comes the reverse-sweep, not got hold of it completely but the ball skitters past short third man and away
Agar to Roy, 1 run uses the feet and punches into a gap
Stoinis to Roy, no run short of a length on off stump, Roy cracks it to extra cover
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run dug in, the angle is straighter and this is pulled square to the man on the rope
Stoinis to Bairstow, 2 runs short of a length, pulled in front of the deep midwicket sweeper
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run length outside off, Bairstow comes across and punches to mid-off
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run in the channel, clubbed off a length past extra cover, YJB wants two but Agar is quickly in off the rope to keep them honest
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run fired in full, Roy digs eh ball out to midwicket and immediately sets off... but the throw misses!
Lyon to Roy, 1 run looped up outside off, Roy walks down and clips to long-on
Lyon to Bairstow, 1 run pushed through and cut for one going back in the crease
Lyon to Roy, 1 run flat delivery, Roy steers a single through point
Lyon to Bairstow, no run flighted, punched into the off side
Lyon to Bairstow, FOUR runs exasperation for Lyon as Bairstow sweeps on off stump, just gets a tickle of bat on it and the ball races to fine leg for four
Lyon to Bairstow, no run pushed through, nudged towards mid-on
Stoinis to Roy, 2 runs attempted yorker, almost in the blockhole... but Roy digs it out with such sweet timing that he nearly beats long-on with a straight drive, they come back for two
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run punched on top of the bounce into the covers, good throw as they steal the single... but Bairstow beats the direct hit from Neser!
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run short ball, YJB swats a loopy top edge down to fine leg
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run pushed into a gap in front of point
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run pitched up and tucked into a gap at cover
Stoinis to Roy, 1 wide maybe a slower ball, but that's looped away outside off
Stoinis to Roy, 2 runs on the stumps, whipped firmly into the leg side as deep midwicket charges around
Lyon to Bairstow, 1 run swept firmly out through square leg
Lyon to Roy, no run hello, massive tweaker and Roy is struck on the back pad! Lyon reckons it is going over the top, but it was nicely flighted
Lyon to Roy, no run slapped back down the track, straight to the bowler
Lyon to Roy, 2 runs opens the face, guided past the diving point and gathered on the run by the sweeper
Lyon to Roy, no run down the track and blocked, a touch uneasily
Lyon to Roy, no run a nice rhythm in this over from Lyon, forcing Roy to be on his guard as he drives back down the pitch
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run too short, muscled out through deep square leg
Stoinis to Roy, FOUR runs in the slot, and slogged ferociously on the up through wide long-on!
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run big inswing, but sliding down the leg side as Roy gets a fat inside-edge
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run outside off, biffed through the covers
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run forward and poked to the off side
Stoinis to Bairstow, 2 runs outside off, and crashed through point
Lyon to Roy, no run pushed into the covers
Lyon to Roy, no run down on the sweep, can't make full contact
Lyon to Roy, no run forward and defended to the leg side
Lyon to Roy, 1 run on the back foot, tapped into the gap in the covers.
Lyon to Bairstow, 1 run worked off the pads to the leg side
Lyon to Roy, 1 run tapped down the pitch, England are playing the Goat with respect. He's a seasoned performer in an otherwise rookie line-up
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run clubbed into the off side, not a lot of foot movement as the ball scythes through the line
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run opens the face on a slashing drive, guided to third man. Roy was a bit eager for the single there! Has to reverse-ferret in an undignified rush
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run cracked into the covers again
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run worked on the up to wide mid-on
Stoinis to Bairstow, FOUR runs whipped out to deep midwicket, that's beautifully timed and bissects the field to perfection
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run angled defence to third man

Lyon to Roy, SIX runs absolutely battered over wide long-on and after missing out (relatively) at Trent Bridge, he's made amends here with his hundred! From 81 balls, the fastest of the three so far today, and his sixth overall
Lyon to Roy, 1 run tucked to the leg side to keep the scoreboard ticking
Lyon to Bairstow, 1 run nudged leg-side once more
Lyon to Hales, 1 run dabbed out to point
Lyon to Bairstow, 1 run pushed out to cover
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 2 runs width outside off, slapped out to point
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 2 runs dabbed down through third man, finds space behind square and they think about the third, and think again
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 1 run tucked off the legs for another single
Jhye Richardson to Hales, 1 run outside off, angling in, Hales guides it into the covers with a controlled push
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run attempted drive, but not quite to the pitch of the ball. Scuffed back to the bowler
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 1 run punched firmly out to the cover sweeper

Stanlake to Bairstow, OUT Bairstow falls! No fifth hundred in seven for England's other opener, he tried to get too cute against the height of Billy Stanlake, looking to glide him down to third man, but Paine saw him coming and snaffled a too-thin deflection
Stanlake to Root, 1 run outside off, punched firmly out to point to get off the mark straightaway
Stanlake to Hales, no run forward and blocked into the off side
Stanlake to Hales, 1 run a thrashing square drive from Hales, freeing his levers to crunch through to the cover sweeper
Stanlake to Root, no run edged, but all along the ground! Not really a threat of a chance, but slip does well not to let that scud through to the rope
Stanlake to Root, no run beaten outside off, and that is a beauty! Probably the first one that has genuinely beaten the bat in this innings.
Jhye Richardson to Hales, 1 run punched out to the deep
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run left alone outside off stump. That is probably another first!
Jhye Richardson to Root, 1 run tapped to cover and a sharp single, soft hands making that decision easy enough
Jhye Richardson to Hales, FOUR runs wide line, a thick under-edge, and away through to fine leg. That'll do
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run good follow-up, tighter to the stumps, demanding a respectful forward press from the lanky Hales
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run opens the face, and glides a drive to point
Stanlake to Root, 2 runs pace from Stanlake! Root rides the bounce with a flinch, and gloves a single to the leg side
Stanlake to Root, 2 runs pressed with a hop, out through backward point. Lots of runs there today
Stanlake to Root, no run full length, defended back down the pitch, this has been good from Australia, just turning what's left of their screw on the England batsmen
Stanlake to Root, no run solidly into line to drive to mid-off
Stanlake to Root, no run snorter! This one bursts past the edge as Root flinches inside the line
Stanlake to Root, no run onto the front foot, Australia are brawling, and Stanlake looks the likely lad
Stoinis to Hales, no run big appeal as Hales is rapped on the pad, but that seems to be sliding down as they decline the review
Stoinis to Hales, no run punched on the up to mid-on, Hales is being very watchful at the top of his innings ... such a contrast to Tuesday
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run slower ball, defended into the leg side
Stoinis to Root, 1 run tailing in on the leg stump, and clipped to the leg side
Stoinis to Hales, no run there's some shape here for Stoinis, swinging late into Hales' toes. Punched with a high elbow back down the pitch
Stoinis to Hales, no run back of a length, tight line, clubbed to mid-off
Stanlake to Root, no run defended into the off side
Stanlake to Root, no run on the pads, clipped urgently to short midwicket
Stanlake to Root, no run pushed to the off side
Stanlake to Root, no run back of a length, Root lines up the pull but is hit amidships. Good wheels from Billy Whizz
Stanlake to Root, no run firm defence with a high elbow, back down the pitch
Stanlake to Root, 1 run width, and kangaroo-cut over third man, one bounce to the man set back on the rope
Stoinis to Root, no run met with a front-footed punch back down the pitch
Stoinis to Root, 1 run too short this time, and comfortably pulled into the gap at deep midwicket
Stoinis to Hales, FOUR runs slower ball, good thinking, but far too short and too easily clobbered off the toe of the bat, away through cow corner
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run fuller length, tailed into the pads, and worked behind square
Stoinis to Root, 1 run flicked off the pads once more
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run punched into the covers
Neser to Hales, 2 runs punched firmly off the back foot, out to deep cover

Neser to Hales, no run edged and dropped by Paine! Oh Lordy, that is horrendous. A catching-practice deflection from Hales, outside off and dangled through to the keeper, who stooped and let the edge bobble straight out! Oh dear...
Neser to Hales, 1 run worked to the leg side this time. Australia seem a bit stunned by that let-off
Neser to Root, no run pushed into the off side
Neser to Root, no run a touch of movement away from the right-hander, and dabbed to gully
Neser to Root, FOUR runs over-pitched this time, and drilled back down the ground, takes Neser's boot as it goes by, but that is too well timed and rolls all the way to the rope
Agar to Hales, no run tossed up and punched back to the bowler
Agar to Hales, 1 run an open-faced punch into the covers
Agar to Root, no run Root is pushed back into his crease this time, and defends once more
Agar to Root, no run punched back to the bowler
Agar to Root, 1 run forward and drilled down to long-off
Neser to Root, FOUR runs leaning back, mown over deep midwicket, if you miss your length you get punished on this pitch
Neser to Root, no run much better length, Root stretches forward this time
Neser to Root, no run whipped to midwicket
Neser to Root, 1 run guided down to third man for another single
Neser to Hales, no run dabbed to the off side, better length now from Neser
Neser to Hales, no run keeps low as Hales adjusts late, albeit with no footwork, and jabs down to defend his timbers
Agar to Root, 1 run pushed into the covers
Agar to Hales, no run driven on the up to long-on
Agar to Hales, 1 run
Agar to Root, no run punched from deep in the crease, snaffled in the followthrough
Agar to Morgan, 1 run goes deep in the crease to work his first single into the leg side
Neser to Morgan, no run onto the front foot, and punched into the covers
Neser to Morgan, 1 run back of a length, tapped out to the leg side. Singles will suffice for England
Neser to Hales, no run blocked back down the track
Neser to Hales, 1 run opens the face and guides out to point
Neser to Morgan, no run punched to short cover once more
Neser to Morgan, 1 run back of a length, clipped out to deep midwicket
Agar to Morgan, no run worked off the front foot back down the pitch but grabbed in the follow-through
Agar to Morgan, FOUR runs paddy-whacked through backward point! He's so quick and effective on that shot, reversing the hands and just pulling the lone fielder hither and thither
Agar to Morgan, 2 runs punched in front of square this time, on the back foot
Agar to Morgan, FOUR runs plants the front foot, and boshes one over the top. Not quite timed but impressive intent from the captain
Agar to Morgan, 2 runs nailed in front of square once again
Jhye Richardson to Hales, 1 run back of a length and punched through point from the crease
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 1 run touch short outside off and Buttler gets off the mark first ball with a steer square
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run comes across and taps into the covers
Jhye Richardson to Hales, 1 run fullish outside off, Hales runs the ball behind point for a single
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, no run pitched up, Buttler taps into the covers
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 2 runs back of a length, bit if width and he throws the hands through a slice behind deep point for two
Agar to Hales, no run angled in and tapped back to the bowler
Agar to Hales, no run tossed up, Hales drives along the ground back into Agar's hands
Agar to Buttler, no run pushed through and tapped to extra cover
Agar to Buttler, no run flat on the stumps, Buttler nurdles to midwicket
Agar to Buttler, FOUR runs ouch, that's some wristy power, crunched off the back foot past midwicket and the man in the deep can't get around the rope to cut it off... First boundary for Buttler
Stanlake to Hales, 1 run short outside off and sliced down to third man
Stanlake to Buttler, 2 runs stops a touch in the pitch, Hales chips in the air but clears cover and gets away with it again!
Stanlake to Buttler, 1 run length, driven hard on the up through the off side
Stanlake to Hales, 1 run dug in short and Hales pulls through square leg
Stanlake to Buttler, 1 run Buttler swats the ball for one more
Stanlake to Hales, no run pitched up and this skips through low underneath the bat
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 1 run shortish outside off and chopped into the covers
Jhye Richardson to Hales, 1 run full in the channel, Hales clamps down and gets a toe-end towards third man
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, FOUR runs short ball, Buttler latches on and hammers a pull way through backwards square
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, FOUR runs short of a length in the channel and Buttler blitzes a cut, uppish but clears the dive of backward point and races for four more
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, no run comes across and pushes into the covers
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, FOUR runs Richardson drops short and Hales collars him this time, smote through in front of midwicket and the fielder hasn't a hope!
Stanlake to Hales, no run back of a length and defended to leg
Stanlake to Hales, no run good nut from Stanlake, seaming back in as Hales hangs back, gets an inside edge on to his pads
Stanlake to Hales, no run short and wide, goes to cut but rather plops it towards backward point
Stanlake to Hales, 1 run chopped into the off side, Buttler calls him through for a tight single

Stanlake to Buttler, FOUR runs woof! Pick that out... Buttler stand still on off, waits on the overpitched delivery and then blaps it through the covers! The equivalent of sticking a free-kick right in the top corner
Stanlake to Buttler, 1 run full and dabbed through the off side for one more to keep the strike
Neser to Buttler, no run full, slips this one under the bat as Buttler swings and misses
Neser to Buttler, FOUR runs wristy power, full in the channel and slashed away behind point, opening the face and finding the gap
Neser to Buttler, FOUR runs ah, that's a genuine half-volley, Buttler steps on to the front foot and hoofs it over mid-off, bounces just in front of the rope
Neser to Buttler, 1 run comes down and prods into a gap
Neser to Hales, FOUR runs bit of width, Hales flashes hard and squirts a third boundary in the over through backward point
Neser to Hales, 1 run on the stumps, turned into the leg side for one
Lyon to Hales, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, clipped through mid-on
Lyon to Buttler, no run nudged with the spin to square leg
Lyon to Buttler, no run pushed through outside off and Buttler pings it to point
Lyon to Buttler, no run pushed through and Buttler again finds the infield on the off side
Lyon to Buttler, 1 bye tossed up and spinning through the gate, Buttler plays around it but it beats Paine, too, and they nick a bye
Lyon to Hales, no run comes across on off and prods away
Neser to Buttler, 1 wide sliding down the leg side
Neser to Buttler, FOUR runs power from Buttler again, a low full toss and that bottom hand comes through to club four more through cover
Neser to Buttler, no run length, poked into the off side
Neser to Buttler, (no ball) SIX runs high full toss, Buttler sees it big and slugs a home run into the crowd at deep midwicket! That's a no-ball on height, but didn't stop him smashing six!
Neser to Buttler, 2 runs spooned straight up, this will be caught coming in from long-on... but they run two while it's in the air, bringing up Buttler's fifty from 28 balls! Phew
Neser to Buttler, FOUR runs overpitched, Buttler fires one final bottom-handed blast over cover, seals a six-wicket win for England!
England won by 6 wickets (with 32 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Jason Roy, ENG
